DataElement.preferredName: European Union Drug Regulating Authorities Clinical Trials Database Clinical Study Identifier
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A unique identifier assigned to a European Union Drug Regulating Authorities Clinical Trials Database clinical study.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: European Union Drug Regulating Authorities Clinical Trials Database Clinical Study
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The European Union's electronic database of clinical trials. It contains information submitted by sponsors and informs users about ongoing clinical trials in EU Member States and European Economic Area countries._Research conducted with human subjects or on material of human origin in which an investigator directly interacts with human subjects; includes development of new technologies, study of mechanisms of human diseases, therapy, clinical trials, epidemiologic, behavior, and health services research.

ObjectClass.preferredName: European Union Drug Regulating Authorities Clinical Trials Database
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The European Union's electronic database of clinical trials. It contains information submitted by sponsors and informs users about ongoing clinical trials in EU Member States and European Economic Area countries.

Concepts.longName: European Union Drug Regulating Authorities Clinical Trials Database
Concepts.definition: The European Union's electronic database of clinical trials. It contains information submitted by sponsors and informs users about ongoing clinical trials in EU Member States and European Economic Area countries.

Property.preferredDefinition: Research conducted with human subjects or on material of human origin in which an investigator directly interacts with human subjects; includes development of new technologies, mechanism of human diseases, therapy, clinical trials, epidemiology, behavior and health services research.

Concepts.definition: Research conducted with human subjects or on material of human origin in which an investigator directly interacts with human subjects; includes development of new technologies, study of mechanisms of human diseases, therapy, clinical trials, epidemiologic, behavior, and health services research.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the management of a research protocol and its case report forms.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Research conducted with human subjects or on material of human origin in which an investigator directly interacts with human subjects; includes development of new technologies, study of mechanisms of human diseases, therapy, clinical trials, epidemiologic, behavior, and health services research._One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the management of a research protocol and its case report forms.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A formal document that describes a complete plan of research activity in the framework of a clinical study; specifically, the study objective(s), design, methodology, eligibility requests for prospective subjects and controls; intervention regimen(s), proposed methods of analysis of data; statistical considerations, and organization of the study. The protocol usually also provides the background and rationale for the trial, but these could be represented in other protocol referenced documents.:One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

Concepts.definition: A formal document that describes a complete plan of research activity in the framework of a clinical study; specifically, the study objective(s), design, methodology, eligibility requests for prospective subjects and controls; intervention regimen(s), proposed methods of analysis of data; statistical considerations, and organization of the study. The protocol usually also provides the background and rationale for the study, but these could be represented in other protocol referenced documents.
One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.
